reviews.review:
Things are easier to see unlike before where its just absolute darkness and i just dont know if that should be good or not, animations are worse than before for some reason like wtf, why the heck would you change the the skill check circle, which takes time to get used to to get right?

in my personal preference the hud looks good but the positions are just disorienting.

I used to really enjoy this game, but the more I play the less I really understand why. You run around a pallet until the survivor drops it, then break it and move to the next one. Every map is designed in a way so the survivors can chain together multiple 'loops' wasting as much time as possible, and have numerous second chance abilities to fall back on if they make a mistake. Killers meanwhile get one second chance perk, and it's considered 'toxic and unearned.' There's no real agency on the killer's part; unless you get a good mindgame or prediction, it is incredibly unrewarding and unsatisfying. When you down a survivor, you don't think "yeah I got them," you think "thank God I finally got them" and that's not the experience I want when playing as famous powerhouses like Pyramid Head or Michael Myers.

it's got almost every famous horror character you'd ever want, but in a game that is actively getting worse with each update. all player feedback goes into the trash. BHVR continues to push barely functional updates and unwanted content while after nearly five years of development the core gameplay loop remains stale and unchanged. they just don't care. 
playing dress up with your characters is both the endgame and the main incentive to even play. now drop your cash on the battlepass, some $20 costumes, and some 7$ DLC's you fuck.

and it's such a shame thinking of the great potential Dead by Daylight had when you consider the amount of both famous and original horror characters it has; but in the end it's all shallow and meaningless set dressing that amounts to nothing. 
due to the decisions of BHVR, this game will forever stay a simple cops-and-robbers tag game with barely a veneer of horror aesthetics slapped on. and even then it's still laughably incompetent at being something so simple.

Edit: Can't believe I wrote this before Boon Totems came out! Things are even worse now! Blatant cheaters in every game and a broken MMR system. Literally nobody likes the new matchmaking system and player frustration is at an all time high. Playing killer is now so unfun and stress-inducing that the devs are implementing a way to bribe players with extra rewards just to play killer, and that's ON TOP of the already higher bloodpoint gain killers get. Instead of addressing SWF. or the broken matchmaking, or the perk tier/bloodpoint grind, they're releasing Ringu chapter, another M1 killer with no potential and even more perks. Just more perks, more grind, more bloat, more frustration, and it's been going for years. This game is such dogshit.

While the concept of this game is fun the way the game is made is just awfull. I do not recommend as I have come across multiple gamebreaking bugs that have not been patched for a month. You need over 100 hours to buy one character (killer or survivor) and unlocking perks is pure grind without DLC perks. I had my fun but bugs overshadow every minute. You can have fun but this game is as close to corporate greed you can get without buying from EA.

Il y a toujours eu des soucis sur DBD. Des bugs, la communauté irascible, certaines perks, des fichiers toujours à retélécharger parce que mal acquis...la dernière mise à jour était un pompom sur le gateau de non-amusement qu'est devenu le jeu. Les tueurs tapent en wifi à travers les murs, on est sortis des parties pour diverses raisons et on se prends une pénalité d'attente, les nouveaux mouvements donnent l'impression de manier un semi-remorque, le HUD est moins clair...Je joue depuis deux ans au jeu, et la dernière maj était celle de trop. Jeu désinstallé. C'est un bon jeu pourtant, mais tous les éléments négatifs cumulés font qu'il y a plus aucun amusement.

Игра в помойку

This game has a very interesting concept of asymmetrical gameplay (even though it's essentialy a glorified "tag" game of running after/away from people), but sadly I would not recommend it.

People are not exaggerating when they say how bad the development team is. They clearly have no clue about what to do with the game, for the most part. So many things are unfair and unbalanced (in a crappy design way, not because it's an asymmetrical game), serious bugs remain for months while superfluous changes are made for the sake of selling cosmetics. The rationale behind most decisions show how the devs are absolute noobs at their own game, yet too entitled to seek the help of consultants who actually play the game. They have something called "fog whisperers", who are players/streamers supposedly able to give opinions about the game, but even the most famous ones are consistently and blatantly ignored.

The only reason it still has an active playerbase is the lack of other options for this genre. Hopefully this changes soon, with games such as Monstrum 2 getting more attention.

I do not recommend this game.

Yes, there are a lot of things wrong with this game right now. 

The devs are desperately trying to rush things into the game for god knows what reason. Which results in countless bugs, glitches and other problems which severely kill the quality of life in the game. Since the new patch movement animation for survivors have become a joke, the new hud has already overstayed its welcome, hitboxes are worse then ever and the ranking system has for some unknown reason gone complete to hell and back.

With all this in mind i still think this game is great: in fact, it's pretty awesome!!!! I do believe that the issues above will be fixed in time and i could never forget the countless times in which i felt real fear and stress playing this game which is exactly the thing that makes this game great.

P.S. BILL SKIN WHEN PLS HE DESERVES IT!!!!
This game has so much variety it is good for people, who dont get scared at a lot of things ,but they amount of things you can do in this game and the 100+ perks this game is so fun.

Edit: This review was made for an old version of the game, problems were partially solved, still game's toxic af, I recommend against it if you appreciate your mental health just a bit.



The feeble mind of the community can't understand the gargantuan-sized brain of BHVR.
I mean, they seem to know what the community wants, even though they cry out loud against it.

Also, here is a list of problems that were reported and passed the PTB:
[list]
[*] Survivors now look like they are preparing for a picnic instead of running from a killer
[*] Previous UI elements are now dispersed along the screen. With the previous UI you would collect information from one quick glance over the bottom-left, now you need to scan the entire screen to get the same information.
[*] Hitbox's size are now inversely proportional to community approval. Roll a D20 to see if it hits, advantage applied.
[*] Progressing in the rank system actually makes you regress in the rank system. i.e. gaining a "pip" makes you actually lose the "pip".
[*] If you are hooked, game will play dance music. Won't decide to play a fade-in or a fade-out for current soundtrack, so it will play both effects at random intervals.
[*] As a spectator, if a survivor is hooked, music will decide to die until you close the game.
[*] Perk "Dead Hard" is now triggered 1-2 seconds after the player actually wants to use it.
[*] In loading match-screen, players could make the server angry and get disconnected in tandem.
[*] Spectating a survivor that is escaping makes the game enter into a tantrum and freeze your screen. This does not produce a crash but you have to close the game as it will not let you play anymore. [b]Analyzing it more reflexively, this may be intentional, to be the stress factor in the "Horror" tag[/b]
[*] Survivors may phase into a wall and become stuck there, survivor won't be able to move and can't be hit by the killer, making the game take itself hostage until the survivor or the killer decides to uninstall the game.
[*] As a survivor if you don't escape you will not progress in the ranking system. And guess what? you will not escape too often! making higher ranks of survivors more sweaty and scummy.
[*] Timer progression is now displayed as a shade of bright red [b]over bright red[/b].
[/list]

I would not recommend this game. There are so many things wrong with this game but I'll keep things simple. For starters, the developers do not give 2 shits about the community, they are just in it for the money at this point. Furthermore, if the game was at least decent, you still have to wait anywhere from 5-10 minutes sometimes to get into a sometimes shorter than 5 minute match. Not worth the time, effort, and money and you are better off spending your time elsewhere :)

I was thinking about this a lot if i should write this or not because i used to enjoy and love this game soooo much but i am very heartbroken how ruined my favourite game got. I already voted for a no when a new update came out a few months ago but this is even worse now. Dead by daylight is not fun at all anymore, i get in every single game a hacker killer with speedhack, facecamping, tunneling. The survivers are unsportable as hell, they are thinking on theirself only, this is not a team game anymore, unenjoyable since the newest update. And i am very unhappy because it used to be my favourite game of all time but the community just got very toxic and nobody cares about it. I hope this will get fixed because i am going to miss this game very much.
